Thanks. Didn't think it was the test class's signature problem. 

Test case=
s in different package cannot easily test non-public classes and methods. P=
robably the solution to me is to pack all test cases into a test jar and si=
gn it as well.



--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <saff@...> wrote=
:
>
> So com.company.MyTest is coming from an unsigned .class file, and
> c=
om.company.AgentClass
> is coming from a signed .jar file.  Java doesn't li=
ke mixing signed and
> unsigned classes in the same package, and is telling=
 you so.  The easiest
> thing to do may be to move your test class to a new=
 package.
> 
>
